place.name: SOUTHOE
place.gazetteerText: SOUTHOE, a parish in St. Neots district, Hunts; 2¾ miles NNW of St. Neots r. station. Post town, Buckden, under Huntingdon. Acres, 1,860. Real property, £2,606. Pop., 281. Houses, 61. The manor belonged formerly to the Lovetotes, John of Gaunt, and the Pickerings; and belongs now to Lord Overstone. The living is a vicarage, united with Hail-Weston, in the diocese of Ely. Value, £288.* Patron, the Rev. J. R. Moorsom. The church is ancient, and has a Norman door. There is a national school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
